benchmark_details.name: CASPER (CAsual Speech in Peer Engagement Recordings)
benchmark_details.overview: The paper introduces a comprehensive speech dataset named CASPER, comprising 200 hours of recorded English conversations, of which 158 hours are spontaneous speech, aiming to address the scarcity of high-quality spontaneous speech data.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To provide a dataset that captures the natural flow of dialogue, including disfluencies, pauses, and speaker interactions, aimed at improving downstream tasks in speech processing.

data.source: Recorded conversations between pairs of participants using personal devices.
data.size: 200 hours of recorded audio, 158 hours actual speech
data.annotation: Manual annotation for transcripts and speaker metadata.

methodology.calculation: Metrics calculated using reference transcripts compared to model outputs.
methodology.interpretation: Lower WER indicates better performance for ASR models on spontaneous speech.
methodology.baseline_results: Whisper-large-v3 achieved WER of 0.31, SeamlessM4T-large achieved WER of 0.53.
methodology.validation: Random sampling of conversations for evaluation of ASR and diarization tasks.

targeted_risks.demographic_analysis: Includes demographic metadata of speakers such as accent, age, and gender.
targeted_risks.harm: Potential exposure of personal data and bias in accent representation.

ethical_and_legal_considerations.privacy_and_anonymity: De-identification of audio and metadata to protect participant identity.
ethical_and_legal_considerations.consent_procedures: Participants signed informed consent forms prior to data collection.
